: Was a huge fan of Junk Jack and Junk Jack X on my old iPod 4 touch. Found 
this on the play store by accident. Couldn't be happier. The level of 
detail with both what you can build and find, keeps you coming back for 
more and on a mobile phone much easier to control than Terraria. With the 
huge volume of awful games available on the Playstore, put your hand in 
your pocket and support a game that will surprise you in the care and 
attention to detail these developers have created. The IAP is purely 
optional and in no way required. Great to see you once more Jack! One 
change I'd like to see. The ability to tap an item on the inventory or 
chest to highlight it and then a single tap to place it in your toolbar and 
vice versa, rather than hold down on item and with another finger tap to 
swap it's location to where you're tapping

I love this game when i was a young kid, now i can re-enjoy this game again

Where do I start? Umm... this is an amazing game. I use to love playing 
this game when I was littler on my ipod. The only problem is that this 
isn't an amazing game. "What the heck do you mean?! You can't contradict 
your self. It makes no sense." Let me explain. This is a good game, it's 
just so different from the original version of the game, it feels like its 
not a remake. The Graphics: The graphics of the original was really 
arcade-esk and easy to understand. The colors were very earthy and dark, 
making it easy on the eyes and a treat to look at. The graphics for this 
new version are better and feel very polished... but not ideal. The use of 
brighter colors was not a good step in the direction of different. Plus (a 
personal opinion) the arcade style was one of my favorite things about the 
original. It just felt so... Junk Jack. The Charater Selects: Most of the 
things you have to choose from in the charater select aren't things that 
real people that live in the present year. It feels like your trying to 
dress up someone from the 50s-90s. I don't approve this. The complication 
of almost everything: In the original game, there were 5-7 (7 counting the 
jewelers bench and recycle bench) benches that did different things. It 
wasn't that complicated to build them and once you had them all that was it 
and you could craft anything (assuming you had the material). In this 
version, seriously what the heck? There are way more then 5! And not only 
that, but they are super complicated to make. In the original, the 
selection screen was very simple. You'd click the play button then click 
the world and start playing. Easy right? In the new version, its relatively 
the same, but to make a world you have to go over tons of settings for the 
world to make it. Shure its necessary to set up the world, but you'd not 
think so when the setting are confusing as heck. I kid you not it took me 
like 30 minutes to figure out how to change the world's game mode 
(survival, creative, etc.). It got me really frustrated and I had to look 
it up. That's not a good thing. Try to make it less confusing. Make it 
clear what certain buttons do what and how the heck you change the game 
mode! Another thing (which is a personal option). In the original, you 
played as one Junk Jack who had iconic clothes. Shure they'd change if you 
had one of the store bought things equipped, but in the new one your not 
him! So why call this game Junk Jack if there is NO Junk Jack? Over all 
this is a good game, or atleast is a mediocre time passer that impersonates 
a good game. Most of these things are arguable and are personal opinions. 
Please don't get mad at me.

Fun calming game when you want to escape reality. I like that there's a lot 
of things you can craft and do, but it's not an endless amount of things to 
where it's totally overwhelming and you don't know where to start. I've 
been a fan of this game for 7 years now.

Junk Jack is a phenomenal game. I go way back with this to before junk jack x. To the days where it was simple, real simple. I have already played through this game 3 times (visited all the planets, built many homes and got most the special blocks and loot). This didnt take very long to accomplish. Getting ores will become very easy and I started to lose interest and thats when i started over again. Ores really need to be more scarce. Also with the planets... there should be a reason why you should visit all the planets. Not just for blocks or ores or armor. And getting portal pieces should become harder too. And the "bosses" of all the planets should be harder. It is too easy to kill them. I know these are kind of stupid complaints, I really do adore this game. Definitely worth buying. :)

content: Junk Jack finally found his way to Android! This game was killing it back in the days when Minecraft and Terraria weren't ported to mobile. While this game is no match for Minecraft, it certainly has its pros when compared to Terraria mobile. First, it offers much better controls. Second, the huge amount of treasures it contains means the game will have you treasure hunting a good deal of time! Third, it also offers a much more complex electronics system. On the other hand, its combat system isn't as good as Terraria's and exploring here might be a bit more painful if you don't like to mine your way down most of the time. My suggestion to the devs, try making the caves more connected, since that's pretty rare in this game even with the noticeable improvements to the terrain generation.   Long story short, Terraria is more combat oriented while this one focuses more on collectibles. Both have pros/cons try this if you'd like to play a nice sandbox collecting game.

content: Help. JJ won't work on my Samsung 8!! Can't cope without it!!!

The definitive JJ experience, now available for Android devices and my oh my is it a wonderful game.  Essentially a mash-up of Terraria and Minecraft, the game should feel familiar to anyone who has indulged in both. The game isn't a clone however and establishes itself rather well with a charming personality, clean pixelated art style and buttery smooth controls, built from the ground up for mobile.  There is a wealth of depth here with numerous items to find and craft, hobbies to undertake such as fishing, mining, breeding, fighting and more.  It's a phenomenal game and you can tell love and care went into it. Worth the price of entry? Indeed it is.  The only downside to game is the lack of variety on aesthetic of weapons and armor and the lack of cloud save which really, should bump a star down but I'm sure it'll be added in the future. Fantastic game. Grab it if you're into this genre.
replyContent: Thanks for your honest review, we're glad you are enjoying Junk Jack!

Great game
Hands down my favorite game on Android. Just one request could y'all add cloud saves?

Junk Jack is a game in the same genre as Minecraft Pocket Edition and Terraria, however, unlike those games this game was made for mobile devices (rather than being ports of PC games). This means that the controls and gameplay were made with mobile gaming in mind and it just works! Block placing, interfaces and fights all feel fluid with touchscreen controls and the game has an unbelievable amount of content to offer.  Junk Jack was originally released for iOS devices in 2011 and since then the developers have continued to release updates for it and bring in new content every few months. The game was recently ported to Steam and has finally arrived on Android. It is a very polished and complete game and the amount of love and time that has gone into developing it really shows.  I can honestly lose myself underground mining and discovering new underground biomes with unique chests and all kinds of loot as well as portal pieces and altars which summon boss monsters. There are 11 planets to explore in total with each unique planet having its own ecosystem of flora and fauna. The pixel art is also incredible and coupled with the smooth lighting engine makes for a very beautiful game!
My brother recommended this to me and I like the game so much.
A great mobile sandbox game!

Junk jack is definitely my favorite mobile game of all time everything is amazingly well done from the simple controls to the amazing soundtrack junk jack really is a fully complete package there's so much stuff to do there's many items to collect many monsters to fight and 12 planets to explore! If you love games like Minecraft this is definitely a game you should at least try. Pixbits thank you for finally putting this game on goggle play keep up the good work.ðŸ˜˜ðŸ˜ŽðŸ˜‡Definitely worth the 5 bucksðŸ’°
replyContent: Thanks for your support! Have fun playing Junk Jack :)

replyContent: Hello, this game has all the content from the previously known Junk Jack X, now simply named Junk Jack to make it the same name across all the supported platforms (the original Junk Jack is now named Junk Jack Retro on iOS).
